Event.name: Cause_to_wake
Event.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Agent</fen> or <fen>Cause</fen> causes a <fen>Sleeper</fen> to transition from the <fen>Sleep_state</fen> to wakeful consciousness.
<ex><fex name="Cause">The earthquake</fex> <t>woke</t> <fex name="Sleeper">me</fex> <fex name="Sleep_state">from a nightmare</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Sleeper
Arg.definition: <def-root>The person or being that is sleeping.</def-root>

Arg.name: Agent
Arg.definition: <def-root>The Agent is the person performing the intentional act.</def-root>

Arg.name: Instrument
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the Instrument with which an Agent intentionally affects a Patient.</def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the Means by which an Agent intentionally affects a Patient.</def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the purpose for which an <fen>Agent</fen> wakes the <fen>Sleeper</fen>. <ex>John <t>roused</t> her <fex name="Purpose">to irritate her</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Explanation
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fex name="Explanation">Explanation</fex> for which an intentional act is performed. Mary <t>woke</t> him <fex name="Explanation">because he looked troubled</fex>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Cause
Arg.definition: <def-root>An animate or inanimate entity, a force, or event that produces an effect. Volitionality is not a necessary characteristic of Causes. <ex><fex name="Cause">The rain</fex> <t>woke</t> me.</ex> <ex><fex name="Cause">The smell of cooking</fex> <t>woke</t> the children.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Sleep_state
Arg.definition: <def-root>This describes the state out of which the Sleeper is awakened.</def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition: <def-root>Any description of the event (or state) which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), force (hard, softly), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of an <fen>Agent</fen> that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). </def-root>

Arg.name: Degree
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The degree to which the <fen>Sleeper</fen> ends up awake.
<ex>I couldn't manage to <t>rouse</t> him <fex name="Degr">completely</fex>, he could only mumble.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: wake up.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: cause to emerge from a state of sleep

lexUnit.name: wake.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: emerge or cause to emerge from a state of sleep; stop sleeping.

lexUnit.name: awaken.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: stop or cause to stop sleeping.

lexUnit.name: rouse.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: bring out of sleep; awaken.

lexUnit.name: get up.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: cause to rise from bed after sleeping
